How can I use the `getnettotals` command in Verus?

You can use the `getnettotals` command in Verus by running `verus getnettotals` in the command line. Additionally, you can also use it with curl by sending a JSON-RPC request to the Verus daemon. The example provided in the documentation shows how to do this.

getnettotals

Returns information about network traffic, including bytes in, bytes out,
and current time.

Result:
{
 "totalbytesrecv": n,  (numeric) Total bytes received
 "totalbytessent": n,  (numeric) Total bytes sent
 "timemillis": t    (numeric) Total cpu time
}

Examples:
> verus getnettotals 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getnettotals", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
